definitions.definition: the act or an instance of converting or the process of being converted.
examples: the conversion of food into body tissues
synonyms: sea change; humoroustransmogrification "the conversion of waste into energy"

definitions.definition: the fact of changing one's religion or beliefs or the action of persuading someone else to change theirs.
repentance and change to a godly life.
the adaptation of a building for a new purpose.
examples: the conversion of a house into apartments

definitions.definition: a building or part of a building that has been adapted in this way.
examples: adaptation, alteration, modification, reconstruction, rebuilding, redevelopment, redesign, renovation, rehabilitation the conversion of the building

definitions.definition: the changing of real into personal property, or of joint into separate property, or vice versa.
the manifestation of a mental disturbance as a physical disorder or disease.
the transposition of the subject and predicate of a proposition according to certain rules to form a new proposition by inference.
the act of scoring an extra point or points after having scored a touchdown.
the act of gaining a first down.
(in the context of online marketing) the proportion of people viewing an advertisement and going on to buy the product, click on a link, etc.
examples: you'll see better conversion rates for your local advertising if you include your physical address on your website

definitions.definition: the action of wrongfully dealing with goods in a manner inconsistent with the owner's rights.
examples: he was found guilty of the fraudulent conversion of clients' monies

definitions.definition: the change in a quantity's numerical value as a result of using a different unit of measurement.
